Detailed Description

This class wraps an. 

 InputStream

and a cipher so that 

 read()

methods return data that are read from the underlying 

 InputStream

and processed by the cipher. The cipher must be initialized for the requested operation before being used by a 

 CipherInputStream

. For example, if a cipher initialized for decryption is used with a 

 CipherInputStream

, the 

 CipherInputStream

tries to read the data an decrypt them before returning.

Definition at line 20 of file CipherInputStream.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::security::CipherInputStream::CipherInputStream ( const gaia::storage::InputStream *  is,
const SecretKey *  sk 
) [explicit]

Creates a new. 

 CipherInputStream

instance for an 

 InputStream

and a SecretKey.

Warning: passing a null source creates an invalid 

 CipherInputStream

. All read operations on such a stream will fail.

Parameters:
isthe input stream to read data from.
skthe SecretKey to process the data with.

gaia::security::CipherInputStream::CipherInputStream ( const gaia::storage::InputStream *  is) [explicit, protected]

Creates a new. 

 CipherInputStream

instance for an 

 InputStream

without a cipher. A 

 NullCipher

is created and used to process the data.

Parameters:
isthe input stream to read data from.

Member Function Documentation

int32_t gaia::security::CipherInputStream::available ( ) [inline, virtual]

Returns an estimated number of bytes that can be read or skipped without blocking for more input.

This method returns the number of bytes available in the buffer plus those available in the source stream, but see InputStream#available for important caveats.

Returns:
the estimated number of bytes available

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.

void gaia::security::CipherInputStream::close ( ) [virtual]

Closes this. 

 CipherInputStream

, also closes the underlying input stream and call 

 doFinal

on the cipher object.

bool gaia::security::CipherInputStream::markSupported ( ) [inline, virtual]

Returns whether this input stream supports. 

 mark

and 

 reset

, which it does not.

Returns:
false, since this input stream does not support 
 mark
and 
 reset
.

int32_t gaia::security::CipherInputStream::read ( const gaia::base::ByteArray &  buf,
int32_t  off,
int32_t  len 
) [virtual]

Reads the next. 

 len

bytes from this input stream into buffer 

 buf

starting at offset 

 off

. if 

 buf

is 

 null

, the next 

 len

bytes are read and discarded.

Returns:
the number of bytes filled into buffer 
 buf
, or 
 -1
of the of the stream is reached.
Parameters:
bufthe buffer.
offthe offset to start at.
lenthe number of bytes.

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.

int64_t gaia::security::CipherInputStream::skip ( int64_t  byteCount) [virtual]

Skips byteCount bytes in this stream.

Subsequent calls to read will not return these bytes unless reset is used.

Parameters:
byteCountthe number of bytes to skip. skip does nothing and returns 0 if byteCount is less than zero.
Returns:
the number of bytes actually skipped.

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.
